newsitem.title: FINLAND: Nokia in software deal with Data Fellows.
newsitem.headline: Nokia in software deal with Data Fellows.

text.p: Finnish telecommunications group Nokia Oy said in a statement on Monday it had agreed with Data Fellows to integrate the latter's encryption software into its own wireless data networking solutions.
Thanks to the partnership with Data Fellows, Nokia said it would be able to provide GSM operators with a networking solution meeting strict security requirements.
"The Nokia Artus solution enables GSM operators to offer secure corporate Intranet solutions, without the requirement of using costly leased lines to reach their corporate customers," it said.

New Nokia technology will enable network operators to establish an internet access point and bridge together internet protocol data networking and wireless networks, Nokia said, adding that weakness of remote access security had earlier discouraged remote access to corporate networks.
"The Nokia Artus Access Manager manages the different levels of access security," it said.
Data Fellows' "military-strength" cryptographic security prevents malicious access to the transferred information, Nokia said.
"This means new business for GSM networks," Nokia Telecommunications Wireless Data Server Systems vice president Petri Poyhonen said in the statement.
"A major business potential for wireless operators is to further extend corporate Intranets to the world of wireless coverage," Nokia added.
